intro: Meibomia arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Meibomia arizonica is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
